text: Most comets originate in one of two regions : the Kuiper belt or the Oort cloud .
Halley ’s Comet originated in the Kuiper belt .
The shortest-period comet ( Encke ’s Comet ) orbits the Sun once every 3 years .
However , only a tiny fraction of Oort cloud comets have orbits that bring them into the inner solar system .

Like the asteroids in the inner solar system , most Kuiper belt comets move in slightly elliptical orbits that lie roughly in the same plane Kuiper belt comets or the gravitational influence of one of the Jovian planets occasionally alters their orbits sufficiently to send them into our view .
The asteroid belt The orbits of most asteroids lie between Mars and Jupiter .
Comet Holmes , which orbits the Sun every 6 years , was uncharacteristically active during its most recent entry into the inner solar system .
Named in honor of astronomer Gerald Kuiper , who predicted its existence , the Kuiper belt hosts comets that orbit in the outer solar system , beyond Neptune .

In 2006 , the International Astronomical Union organized solar system objects not classified as planets or moons into two broad categories : ( 1 ) small solar system bodies , including asteroids , comets , and meteoroids , and ( 2 ) dwarf planets .
Most Oort cloud comets orbit the Sun at distances greater than 10,000 times the Earth-Sun distance .
